content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Extraction System Component at Position(-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)
Use-case: Extracts items from the resource source for subsequent transport.

### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
- Factory Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT (neighbors include the assembling machine)
- Secondary Burner Inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) waiting for source items
- Assembling Machine (assembling-machine-1) at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)
Use-case: Receives raw copper plates and processes them into copper cable.

### Belt Depot for Extraction Connection at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Belt Depot Wooden Chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) (crafted and placed as the depot)
- Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) adjacent to the depot chest
- Depot Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP (its pickup is associated with the depot chest)
Use-case: Acts as an isolated belt target to receive items from the extraction system without misinterpretation as a steam engine.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors:
  – When connecting transport belts, ensure the target entity is an appropriate inserter—not a power generator such as a steam engine. Verify the target’s type before initiating a connection.

• Entity Placement Errors:
  – If placement fails due to the target being too far (e.g., distance exceeding the maximum allowed), move closer to the intended position prior to placement.
  – Confirm that the required entity is available in the inventory before attempting placement to avoid missing-item errors.

• Variable Reference Errors:
  – Ensure all variables (for example, the intended target entity such as “target_chest”) are defined and correctly referenced to prevent NameError issues.
